Pro-Russians must be the only group to complain about a 99% success rate for their missiles getting through.   I‚Äôll never forget the cope about   every single Iskander interception video supposedly being AI.

Well, an edited version of one the videos has been posted so I can share it here. 
This video shows Kinzhal debris falling just short of the oil refinery.
Obviously the Ukrainian airforce claim is false. One Kinzhal was shot down, not two.

I wonder where the second Kinzhal went?

Footage showing the moment of two Russian Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs striking the Pechenihy Dam. Earlier, what was reportedly a Banderol jet-drone impacted it.
The road over this dam is one of the primary supply routes for the entire section of the frontline between Vovchansk and Kupyansk. 
Coordinates: 49.88231, 36.98045

The Nigerian Airforce carried out airstrikes on the Togbin military barracks in the city of Cotonou, Benin, targeting rebels who carried out the earlier failed coup attempt. 
ECOWAS has since announced that they are deploying their "Standby Force" to assist the Benin Government.

The Nigerian Airforce carried out airstrikes on the Togbin military barracks in the city of Cotonou, Benin, targeting rebels who carried out the earlier failed coup attempt. 
ECOWAS has since announced that they are deploying their "Standby Force" to assist the Benin Government.

The Nigerian Airforce carried out airstrikes on the Togbin military barracks in the city of Cotonou, Benin, targeting rebels who carried out the earlier failed coup attempt.   ECOWAS has since announced that they are deploying their "Standby Force" to assist‚Ä¶

Local sources reported that a ground assault was carried out on the Togbin Barracks a few hours ago, which was held by approximately 30 armed men, including one of the coup leaders. The complex has since been deserted, and a large number of weapons have reportedly been seized.

Violent clashes have broken out along the Thai-Cambodia border, with both sides engaged in mutual artillery shelling and small-arms battles.
The Thai Royal Air Force has carried out at least 8 airstrikes against Cambodian positions, while Cambodian artillery shelling has killed at least one Thai soldiers.
Two Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the Chernihiv Power Plant in Chernihiv City.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Tykhe, Pokrovsk'e direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~125.
Total land area: ~0.63 km¬≤.

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Dorozhnje, Dobropillya direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~96.
Total land area: ~0.47 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Rivne, Dobropillya direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~667.
Total land area: ~0.70 km¬≤.
The fighting for Rivne lasted approximately 1 months, 4 days.

To add to this: I believe russia could improve by making a more concerted effort to consolidate in towns before pushing past them. Almost like what they failed to do in the early stages of the SMO on a much smaller scale. Perhaps a dedicated brigade/task force could follow behind the main assault group and mop up properly

In the Stepnohirsk direction, Russian forces intensified their assault operations, making substantial progress over the last few days.
In the southeast, Russian forces broke through Ukrainian defences east of Kamyanske, advancing northeast up both banks of the river. Other forces cleared the western houses of Stepove, and levelled the frontline northwest of the village. 
From there, a general push north was carried out, with Russian forces advancing downhill to the gulleys, and consolidating further northwest in coordination with the push up the northern bank of the river. Russian soldiers then infiltrated from their newly captured positions, advancing uphill towards the gulley west of Pavlivka, while others pushed northwest across another gulley into the former Mining and Processing Plant. Additionally, some Russian soldiers infiltrated from eastern Stepnohirsk towards the Solar field in coordination with the push to the Mining and Processing Plant, threatening to encircle the remaining Ukrainian strongpoints in the fields to the south. 
To the northwest, Russian forces continued their assault operations in Stepnohirsk. They were able to capture Molodizhna and Radianska Streets and consolidate in the first high-rise buildings of the town centre. They also consolidated in the residential areas northeast and northwest of the central high-rise buildings and are clearing the remaining areas of Stepnohirsk still in the grey zone. 
+ ~18.75 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Orikhiv direction, some time over the last few weeks Ukrainian forces carried out a series of successful counterattacks in Mala Tokmachka, recapturing most of the village.
Following the earlier Russian advances and the arrival of Ukrainian reinforcements from Orikhiv, Ukrainian forces managed to regain the initiative and begin pushing back through the settlement. After heavy fighting, they were able to clear the forward Russian positions in the western streets, and due to a lack of Russian manpower in the village, reached the centre, entering the prison and local school. Fighting is still ongoing for the central part of the village. 
+ ~10.10 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.

Lot‚Äôs of reports on Russian assault operations and advances coming out of the front southwest of Siversk. 
If Russia can get exploit these movements to make tactical gains, they could place FPV drone operators far enough forward to begin turning Kramatorsk into a ‚Äúdead city‚Äù (like Dobropillya) and make logistics and accumulation there far more difficult for Ukraine. 
Remember, there are currently no anti-drone nets within Kramatorsk.

Lot‚Äôs of reports on Russian assault operations and advances coming out of the front southwest of Siversk.   If Russia can get exploit these movements to make tactical gains, they could place FPV drone operators far enough forward to begin turning Kramatorsk‚Ä¶
Keep in mind, this front has remained largely stagnant since the fall of Bakhmut in May 2023.

Zelenskyy Flies To Europe Amid Fresh Wave Of Strikes On Ukrainian Infrastructure
The Ukrainian Air Force reported that on the night of December 8, the Russian side deployed 149 attack unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), of which, according to their data, 131 were intercepted or suppressed. 
Particular attention in recent days has been drawn to the city of Fastiv in the Kyiv region, which came under attack for the third consecutive night. Reports indicate significant damage to the railway station, which is believed to have disrupted the supply lines for Ukrainian forces on the right bank of the Dnipro River. Local authorities announced plans to demolish the destroyed station building and construct a new one. Energy infrastructure also remained a target. The capital, Kyiv, was plunged into darkness due to the implementation of extended power outage schedules, causing discontent among residents.
üëâ

Coup Attempt Shakes France‚Äôs Grip On Benin
A coup d‚Äô√©tat was foiled in Benin on December 7, with signs of indirect intervention by France. The poor planning of the coup attempt suggests that it may have been a trap for dissatisfied officers. Still, the attempt highlighted the growing instability in the former French colony.
The coup attempt began in the early hours of December 7, with troops from the country‚Äôs National Guard attacking the residence of President Patrice Talon in the port city of Cotonou. The troops quickly seized the national broadcaster, and the home of Major General Abou Issa, the army chief of staff.
Eight of the troops declared on state television that Talon had been ‚Äúremoved from office as president of the republic‚Äù. They also announced the suspension of the constitution and state institutions, and identified themselves as the Military Committee for Refoundation [French: Comit√© Militaire pour la Refondation] (CMR) headed by Lieutenant Colonel Pascal Tigri.

Emboldened By Turkey, Damascus Is Gearing Up For Battle With Kurdish Forces
The deadline for the implementation of the integration agreement signed by the Islamist-led Syrian Interim Government and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) in March is nearing the end of the year. No progress has been made yet, and both sides appear to be inching closer to a heated battle.
Despite reports of advance in talks on implementing the agreement, which is meant to integrate the SDF into the government‚Äôs civilian and military institutions, Al-Monitor revealed late in November that the process, mediated by the United States, has reached a halt.
Aldar Khalil, a senior official in the political wing of the SDF, revealed to the news outlet that there has been no communication from the government since October, accusing them of creating an ‚Äúillusion of process‚Äù ahead of President Ahmed al-Sharaa‚Äôs Washington visit earlier that month.
üëâ

'Unprovoked Invasion': How The West Won The Narrative War
In 2013, Ukraine found itself at a crossroads. The former Soviet Republic was in dire financial¬†straits, and had been offered the opportunity to sign an association agreement with the¬†European Union. This would have fostered political and economic ties between Kiev and¬†Brussels, and been an incremental step towards Ukraine becoming a full-member of the bloc.
Ukraine‚Äôs Baltic neighbours Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia had all become EU members in 2004,¬†and had also joined NATO in the same year. Ukraine becoming an EU member would have¬†resulted in a political, and potentially military, encirclement of Russia along its western border.
As well as the security risks posed by the association agreement, the ethnic makeup of Ukraine¬†was also a factor. The east of the country was composed primarily of ethnic Russians. This¬†included the Crimean Peninsula which was originally Russian territory, but ceded to Ukraine¬†during the Soviet-era.
